page.title: 05COGENHOE CRICKET CLUB.
page.content: In the past Cogenhoe cricketers played their games in neighbouring cow fields and on bare ironstone. In{1951 the pavilion was opened}and in 1982, the cricket club celebrated its{100th anniversary.}Perhaps the most famous member of the club was George J.{Thompson.}In 1894 at the age of 16 he took 8 wickets for 0 runs against local rivals Billing. In 1906 he was one of{Wisden's}5 "Cricketers of the Year". Since then other stalwarts have been and gone. Jack Notton for instance, took 111 wickets in 1921 and the Rev. A. W. Sale was club Captain in the early 1930's. The Club's proudest possession is an exercise book recording the clubs' annual meetings, 1910_1975. For instance in 1920 2 games were abandoned because the teams were hard up and{couldn't afford the fare.
